list_definition.definition: something, eg protective colouring/coloring, that makes an animal, person, building etc difficult for enemies to see against the background

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: The tiger’s stripes are an effective camouflage in the jungle
The soldiers wound leaves and twigs round their helmets as camouflage.
The marines camouflaged their helmets with leaves and grass.

list_ex_of_english: The necessity for camouflaging hangars is a matter of some urgency.
Then we should have horses which, if requisitioned in the event of war, would already be camouflaged.
The effect of it was camouflaged for a time.

Existing research has not focused on the pathways through which camouflaging self-presentations and concern about peer acceptance may act as risk factors for the development of externalizing symptoms.
Figures we had in abundance, but they were figures which clarified instead of camouflaging the reality.
Admittedly, it is dressed up in a form of words that camouflages some of the intention, but that is the reality.
With the best wills in the world, we are embarking on what is, in fact, camouflaged inflation.
After the experiments, stimulation ar tifacts were camouflaged in the broadband data by substituting ar tifact data samples by a linear interpolation between the adjacent time windows.
